shows.title: So, What’s The Story? The Art of Listening & Learning #1
shows.desc:
#1 Listening to stories
With Barbara Glasson and Clive Marsh

The art of listening and learning. A time of reflection and sharing to begin the festival and set the tone for The Foundry conversations across the weekend.

Barbara Glasson and Clive Marsh are the Methodist Church’s President and Vice President and their new book is called So What’s The Story? in which they encourage us to listen to the stories of others as we try to live creative and generous lives of faith and justice in our communities.

shows.title: Getting Your House In Order
shows.desc: Calling all self-builders and retrofitters – this is a conversation for you, about how to make your buildings as sustainable and ecological as possible with Passivhaus expert, Eric Fewster.

shows.title: The problem with belief #1
shows.desc:
A conversation for all those who’ve given up on faith in all sorts of ways and yet who find themselves at home at Greenbelt. Expect open and honest discussion, with respectful listening and robust argument. This first late night conversation invites all participants to name the biggest problem with their own position, their own world view, as a starting point. Do your reasons for your view pass muster in discussion?

Hosted by a London-based pub discussion group led by former conservative Christians, and now agnostics or atheists.

shows.title: A is for Autism
shows.desc: There are estimated to be some 2 million autistic people in the UK today, some with a diagnosis, but many with no formal diagnosis. Join Cavan Wood as he hosts a conversation for autistic people (and their friends and family) about how the church, Greenbelt, and society at large can respond, support, include and campaign with autistic people more and better.

shows.title: A Beginners Guide To Israel-Palestine
shows.desc:
With Sami Awad and Amos Trust
Greenbelt is always banging on about ‘The Occupation’ and equal rights for Palestinians and Israelis. But what if you don’t have a clue about why? This conversation is for all those who want a whistle-stop intro to one of the world’s most intractable, long-lasting struggles for justice – where all questions are welcomed and no one need feel silly.

shows.title: Collective Wisdom for resisting Everyday Extremism
shows.desc:
A continuation of the earlier panel in the Pagoda – This practical workshop will draw on collective wisdom as an essential tool for resisting everyday extremism. We'll spend time reflecting together on key questions raised during the earlier panel about varying forms of extremism and will prompt participants to initiate change in their own context.

With Jill Mann and Lisa-Raine Hunt

shows.title: Brexit Through The Gift Shop
shows.desc: Trick or treat? For Remainers it will be the most frightening Halloween ever. For Brexiteers it will be the best night of their lives. There's no doubting that Brexit has divided our country as never before. Join Danny Dorling in a small group conversation about what we face this autumn as the UK heads towards the (next) deadline and explore how we can be bridge-builders in our riven and unequal communities.
